data.title: Ensure filesystem calls all support forward slash path separators
data.body: Need to verify that using forward slash path separators in the `Atomic.FileSystem` routines work on all platforms w/o needing to resort to using `Atomic.addTrailingSlash`.

data.title: When JSEventHelper is GC'd clear the event handlers, added method to remove event subscriptions by receiver
Addressing Visual Studio C# integration issues in 952
data.body:
Squashed commit:

[5b710af] Adding asset scan begin/end events, new asset event, regenerate C# solution before opening generated C# script/component

[2d90270] Switch C# project generator to use relative paths for source files and post build assembly copy

[16f244c] Binary assemblies in Resources will now be added to generated project assembly, project binary assemblies can be in any path and will be resolved at runtime

data.title: Crash when adding event handlers to javascript programs
data.body:
On Windows, Linux (probably OSX), I found this when testing the joystick event handlers, but it looks like it applies to any event handler. This can be demonstrated with a simple test module mouseTest.js that has been attached as mouseTest.txt because you can't attach a .js file.
Using the RoboMan3D example, add the mouseTest.js to the Scripts directory, and add two lines to main.js thusly
  // This script is the main entry point of the game
  //Load scene
  var mous = require("Scripts/mouseTest");
  Atomic.player.loadScene("Scenes/Test.scene");
  mous.init (Atomic.player.currentScene);

Then run the program and click mouse button 1 until it crashes. Sometimes you have to click like an 8 year old on a saccharin buzz, but it it should crash in a few clicks. There are a couple of examples that are not as susceptible to this, notably Bunnymark and Basic2D.

This is ia a linux stack trace of the problem
(gdb) where
#0  0x00007ffff08cec37 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:56
#1  0x00007ffff08d2028 in __GI_abort () at abort.c:89
#2  0x00000000010dd2dc in duk_default_panic_handler ()
#3  0x00000000010dd32d in duk_default_fatal_handler ()
#4  0x00000000010e24fb in duk_fatal ()
#5  0x00000000010e253f in duk_err_longjmp ()
#6  0x00000000010ed0aa in duk.handle_error ()
#7  0x00000000010eee17 in duk_err_handle_error_stash ()
#8  0x00000000010e9d5e in duk_hobject_getprop ()
#9  0x00000000010ee4d7 in duk_get_prop ()
#10 0x0000000000a75b16 in Atomic::JSEventHelper::HandleEvent(Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) ()
#11 0x0000000000a75f5e in Atomic::EventHandlerImplAtomic::JSEventHelper::Invoke(Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) ()
#12 0x0000000000c09d65 in Atomic::Object::OnEvent(Atomic::Object*, Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) ()
#13 0x0000000000c0c245 in Atomic::Object::SendEvent(Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) ()
#14 0x0000000000c40a91 in Atomic::Input::SetMouseButton(int, bool) ()
#15 0x0000000000c45c7f in Atomic::Input::HandleSDLEvent(void*) ()
#16 0x0000000000c46073 in Atomic::Input::Update() ()
#17 0x0000000000c46962 in Atomic::Input::HandleBeginFrame(Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) ()
#18 0x0000000000c46b4e in Atomic::EventHandlerImplAtomic::Input::Invoke(Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) ()
#19 0x0000000000c09d65 in Atomic::Object::OnEvent(Atomic::Object*, Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) ()
#20 0x0000000000c0c245 in Atomic::Object::SendEvent(Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash, Atomic::Variant>&) ()
#21 0x0000000000c23340 in Atomic::Time::BeginFrame(float) ()
#22 0x0000000000c26877 in Atomic::Engine::RunFrame() ()
#23 0x0000000000c3cb4d in Atomic::Application::Run() ()
#24 0x00000000008a7b19 in main ()

[mouseTest.txt](https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/files/419146/mouseTest.txt)

data.title: Generate TypeScript project files for external editors
data.body:
If you create a TypeScript project and you go to Developer>>Plugins>>TypeScript>>Generate External Editor Project the editor will create a tsconfig.json file in the root of the project and copy its Atomic.d.ts file into a folder "TypeScript" in the root of the project. This means that if you open the project in VS Code or Atom it will have autocomplete.

I am new to working on open source stuff so feel free to criticize as much as you want :)

data.title: Improved TypeScript support for external editing.
data.body:
If the user opens a project in a external editor like Atom, everything should be setup by default so that they don't have to create additional files manually. 

A easy solution would be to copy the Atom.d.ts file into the atomic project folder under a new TypeScript\Typings folder. So it would be MyGameExample\TypesScript\Atomic.d.ts
We should also setup a tsconfig.json file in the root of the project.

I would like to work on this.

data.title: External editor preference setting.
data.body:
The Atomic Editor needs to be able to define what editor the user wants to use to edit code. This can either be the built in monaco editor or an external editor like Atom. We need to decide where this setting would be. I am thinking under we should create a new UI for preferences like these which would be accessed by File>>Preferences.

I would like to do this.

At a later stage we can investigate creating a debugger extensions for editors like Atom and VS Code.

data.title: Direction pad and jump pad disappear in some examples on iOS device
data.body: I'm testing latest master branch, I tested the space game example and the toon town example, no  navigation pads appear.

data.title: UIEditField not getting OnChangedFocus event on creation
data.body:
it appears that the OnFocusedChange event in the UIEditField does not get called when the widget is getting created and when the autofocus:1 value is specified in the tb.txt field. 

Stepping through the debugger shows that the underlying TB widget is triggering the OnFocusedChange Event, but the UIEditField may not be listening for that event yet, so doesn't receive it.

data.title: UIEditFields auto-select contents on enter
data.body:
Fixes #700 and #356 

This PR provides the following enhancements to the UIEditField
- If you tab into it from another field, the contents get auto selected so you can quickly type a new value
- If you click-select the field, the contents get auto selected so you can quickly type a new value
- If a field is already focused and auto selected and you click into it again, the auto-selection will disappear and the caret will appear where you clicked

Some issues I ran across:
It appears that the `OnFocusedChange` event in the UIEditField does not get called when the widget is getting created and when the `autofocus:1` value is specified in the `tb.txt` field.  The `OnFocusedChange` event **is** getting fired by the underlying TB widget, but may be getting triggered too early and the UIEditField doesn't capture it.  

To get around this, I made a modification to the new project dialog to remove the `autofocus` tag and programmatically set focus to the field in the code on creation.  This behaves as expected.  Let me know if this is an acceptable solution and I can look at other places where the auto-focus is being used or if there needs to be some low level research into why that event isn't getting bubbled up.

data.title: Haptic Support for Game Controllers
data.body:
SDL has haptic (rumble) support for OGL, DX9 and DX11, but it needs to be declared in (Graphics) SDL_Init() and then enabled and used in the Joystick/GameConroller Input object. 
There needs to be a test program created for game controllers and the haptic service.
And an example program should be modified to use a game controller and rumble, in addition to the keyboard+mouse.

data.title: provide some basic CEF cursor types in WebView; updated AUTHORS.md
data.body:
- Provide some mappings between SDL and CEF cursors over a WebView, so that the WebView feels more interactive/real.
- Update AUTHORS.md

data.title: Atomic .Net VS2015 preoject integration issues
data.body:
To be able to keep our code in separate libraries, we're working in a custom .sln, with the Atomic-generated AtomicProject.csproj added to it. Working like this we've run into the following:

Adding a .cs file to the project from the AtomicEditor opens the AtomicProject.sln without updating the .csproj first. This means having to go back to the editor and manually regenerate the project first. 
- [x] Project should first regenerate when a file is added, before opening the solution
- [x] Ideally, only the .csproj should be regenerated, not the .sln, allowing devs to add projects to the solution which would be opened by the editor

Adding new files to the project in VS adds them to the AtomicNET directory tree, instead of to Resources. Combined with the above workflow issues adding through the editor this makes adding new files awkward.
- [ ] If the .csproj was kept in the atomic project root, files could rather be generated in /Resources/Scripts, with binaries still being generated to /Resources/AtomicNET if necessary

When generating the .csproj, source files are added using absolute, instead of relative paths. While this is not an issue if the .csproj is regenerated by every developer on the project, the need to do that means losing references added to the project.
- [x] Files should be added using relative paths.

When regenerating the .csproj, both dependencies and NuGet settings are lost. This means every time the AtomicProject.csproj is regenerated (whenever a file is added), all dependencies must be re-added.
- [x] Automatically adding all .dlls under /Resources or /Resources/Plugins to the AtomicProject.csproj's  dependencies when regenerating would be one way to solve the dependencies problem.
- [ ] I'm not sure if there's a way to regenerate a .csproj while preserving some aspects :/ We use a <name>.vcxproj.user in other solutions. This can be copied into the same directory as the <name>.vcproj and its content will be added to project settings when loading, adding the auto-generated aspects to this file instead of the .vcproj might be a solution.
- [ ] A minor one, but naming the .csproj and .dll according to the project itself would be nice, as well as setting the .csproj's default namespace to the name of the project.

data.title: Color History and issue 914 fixes
data.body: This PR is for the remaining #914 items, and adding color history (with preferences persistence) to the ColorChooser.

data.title: Add -Xlinker -no_deduplicate to linker settings for OSX makefiles build
Adding missing CONTRIBUTION_LICENSE.md
fix setting PostUpdate event mask in JSComponent
data.body:
Fix setting PostUpdate event mask in JSComponent
Without this patch, disabling the PostUpdate event does not seem to work for JS components, and (according to the Chrome profiler for the Web version) this can add up to a significant % when there are a lot of nodes.

data.title: Backing out string concat API
Update "Learn" site with updated keyboard shortcuts for the Scene editor
data.body:
The Atomic Game Engine Learn site needs to have the list of keyboard shortcuts updated.

For instance:  SHIFT+Drag object will duplicate the object.

I'm sure there are other shortcuts that have been added recently as well.

data.title: Urho3D 1.6 Update
data.body:
This PR updates Atomic's core and Third Party dependencies to [Urho3D 1.6](https://urho3d.github.io/releases/2016/08/08/urho3d-1.6-release.html) (and some 1.5 updates which happened between the last pull in September and 1.5's release in November)

It also cleans up Atomic modifications (with few exceptions) to be placed between // ATOMIC BEGIN and // ATOMIC END code blocks, while adapting to the new macros and other features.

This is a pretty massive code delta between core and third party source updates, so likely some issues will crop up to handle in post :)

Relevant updates from Urho3D 1.6
- Physically based rendering shaders, techniques, renderpaths and example materials / demo scene.
- JSON load/save option for scenes, nodes and materials.
- Tags added to nodes & UI elements.
- EventProfiler subsystem.
- Improved mouse mode handling on Emscripten.
- Texture2DArray class added.
- RibbonTrail class added.
- Variance shadow mapping option.
- Normal offset option as an alternative to reducing self-shadowing artifacts.
- Arbitrary (freeform) vertex declarations. Legacy bitmask based vertex declarations emulated using them.
- API-independent graphics class headers. Should ensure Urho library ABI compatibility between builds made on different APIs.
- PackageFile support also on Android from within the .apk.
- Optional additive animation blending mode. Based on calculating difference from the bind pose on the fly.
- Directional billboard mode.
- Fixed screen size option for billboards
- Context-wide global variable implementation. Replaces the previous script-only global variables mechanism.
- Aggregate initializers for containers.
- C++11 binding to Urho events using std::bind.
- C++11 variadic template version of SendEvent().
- 64-bit integer support in Serializer / Deserializer.
- String + number operators.
- Template versions of math functions.
- Container class API improvements.
- SharedPtr / WeakPtr implicit upcasting support.
- Matrix2 class.
- Rename escape key name to KEY_ESCAPE for consistency with SDL.
- Make keycodes lowercase for consistency with SDL.
- API to get joysticks by name.
- Detect number of CPU cores on Emscripten if possible.
- Utilize SDLActivity's get arguments feature.
- Configurable minidump write location.
- Engine parameter for enabling/disabling high DPI window mode.
- Skip using the engine frame limiter on iOS when targeting 60 fps or above, to prevent erratic frame rate from sleep calls.
- TmxFile2D & SpriteSheet2D improvements.
- Sprite2D edge offset parameter for removing bleeding artifacts.
- Drawable2D distance sorting.
- Interpolation mode IM_NONE (no interpolation) added to ValueAnimation.
- Segmented PhysicsWorld ray query for performance optimization.
- Hit fraction added to physics cast results.
- Allow custom collision shape subclasses & custom Bullet collision configuration.
- Expanded data returned from NavigationMesh path queries.
- Clone() added to Technique, ParticleEffect & ParticleEffect2D classes.
- IntRect / IntVector2 setters & getters added to XMLElement.
- TryAcquire() added to Mutex class.
- Vector2 Angle() function added.
- StringUtils ToInt() & ToUInt() take an optional base parameter.
- Convenience function Context::CreateObject<T>.
- Convenience template version of ReleaseResource().
- Allow Vector4 to substitute for Color in Variant::GetColor().
- Additional Variant types can function as parameters for AngelScript function / method calls.
- Improve FixedUpdate event to allow it to originate from either PhysicsWorld or PhysicsWorld2D.
- Particle effect, animation playback & sound playback finish events.
- CrowdAgent emits events also from its node.
- Event sent after cloning a Node or Component is done.
- b2Contact pointer added to PhysicsWorld2D collision events.
- Allow updating AnimatedModel's bone bounding box manually.
- Texture SetData() functions modified to use raw Image ptr for consistency and script bindings simplicity.
- Graphics::SetDither() for controlling backbuffer dithering, relevant on mobiles with 16bit backbuffer.
- Graphics::Draw() & DrawInstanced() overload with base vertex index.
- Use glReadPixels() to get pixel data from rendertargets on GLES.
- Highp precision used for GLES shadows.
- Change deferred shaders to use proper world space to be easier to understand.
- Send ElapsedTime uniform to UI rendering.
- Allow overriding culling mode in a pass.
- SendEvent renderpath command that can be used to interleave custom low-level rendering.
- TRANSLUCENT lighting option in shaders, which takes absolute value of N dot L.
- NOUV shader option added for D3D11 compatibility when model data does not contain UVs.
- Buffer variants supported as shader parameters; will be interpreted as an array of floats.
- View & inverse view uniforms supplied to shaders. Obsolete camera rotation uniform removed.
- Skydome shader & technique added.
- Optional object index vertex attribute that can be used by custom instancing schemes.
- Optional additional per-instance Vector4 data, supplied to the shaders as extra texcoords.
- Logging of D3D9 / D3D11 HRESULTs and proper failure check discipline for D3D object creation.
- Improved occluder sorting.
- Optimize to not render invisible View3Ds.
- Optimized Image::Clear() for RGBA case.
- Optimized SinCos() function added to speed up e.g. billboard calculations.
- Optimized IsPowerOfTwo() function.
- Optimization to amount of Frustum::UpdatePlanes() calls in rendering.
- Update to Civetweb 1.7.
- Update to GLEW 1.13.0.
- Update to libcpuid 0.2.2.
- Update to LuaJIT 2.1.0.
- Update to LZ4 r131.
- Update to nanodbc 2.12.4.
- Update to pugixml 1.7.
- Update to SDL 2.0.4.
- Update to SQLite 3.13.0.
- Update to stb_image 2.12, stb_image_write 1.02, stb_rect_pack 0.08 & stb_vorbis 1.09.
- Generic ARM on Linux platform support.
- Android NDK r11 & r12 support.
- Reduce exposure to SDL headers from Urho's headers.
- Fix various uninitialized variables.
- Fix DirExists() on Android.
- Fix potential crash when using MessageBox from C++.
- Fix erroneous fog shader uniform being set in some rendering cases.
- Fix use of deprecated usleep() function in favor of nanosleep().
- Fix toggling mouse visibility right at application start.
- Fix instancing in HLSL water shader.
- Fix Android / iOS reporting mouse as grabbed.
- Fix update event subscription in Material class.
- Fix window getting maximized after fullscreen -> windowed change on Windows + SDL 2.0.4.
- Fix bogus SDL joystick registration on Android.
- Fix insertion of further drawable updates during threaded drawable update.
- Fix Emscripten performance loss due to enabling SSE mode incorrectly.
- Fix incorrect terrain index data generation.
- Fix incorrect 2D drawable culling optimization.
- Fix transform applying order for parented 2D rigidbodies.
- Fix incorrect rendering caused by not updating shader parameter has when a material is cloned.
- Fix FileWatcher getting in stuck on read() on Linux.
- Fix WorldToHeightMap() in Terrain.
- Fix 2D particle emitter potentially causing memory overwrite by emitting more particles than allocated.
- Fix culling issues when non-master AnimatedModels are larger than the master.
- Fix potentially incorrect viewport update order.
- Fix D3D11 dynamic textures to use only 1 mip level, as more does not work.
- Fix SDL Windows-specific mouse move internals not working in some cases (e.g. without Aero) leading to wrong relative mouse input.
- Fix initial position of kinematic rigidbodies after being loaded.
- Fix temporary AnimatedModel's bones to be temporary as well.
- Fix SSE / ABI incompatibility related crashes with Bullet.
- Fix HasSubscribedToEvent() missing from scripting.
- Fix UI scrollbar snap epsilon attribute default value.
- Fix String::DecodeUTF16().
- Fix CustomGeometry bounding box update when committing new data.
- Fix sprite textures to use clamp addressing by default instead of wrap.
- Fix depth test potentially disabled in OpenGL by third party programs such as MSI Afterburner (re-enable every frame.)
- Fix writing rendertarget inverse size uniforms incorrectly (Vector2 instead of Vector4.)
- Fix off by one error in mipmap data size counting.
- Fix PhysicsWorld::GetRigidBodies() to use immediate contact test for static bodies.
- Fix sampling of depth buffer in read-only mode on D3D11.
- Fix ForwardDepth renderpath potentially missing depth clear on OpenGL.
- Fix possible crash issue when exiting engine with background loaded resources still in queue.
- Fix issues with parented rigidbodies when moving them from code.
- Fix math class equality operator in SSE builds on specific Visual Studio versions.
- Fix ScreenToWorldPoint() to return the specified Z distance.
- Fix vegetation shadow shader on D3D11.
- Fix Application.h to be usable without other include files.
- Fix lighting interpolator order in D3D11 shaders.
- Fix node's Z coordinate not retained in 2D physics movement.
- Fix potential crash and performance issues in Octree raycasts by making them non-threaded; in practice the spin-up time for work items could override any threading benefits.
- Fix point fill mode on D3D11.
- Fix input focus loss when using an external window handle.
- Fix ABI incompatibility in BoundingBox class depending on URHO3D_SSE flag.

data.title: Why does PIXEL_SIZE exist?
data.body: And what does PIXEL_SIZE mean? it's confusing me.

data.title: Added July's contributors to backers.md
[Linux] Pulse audio issues with CPU usage and black screen at startup
data.body: I followed the build instructions and built the latest master on Ubuntu 14.04 64-bit. After launching the editor I can see it continuously uses 110-120% CPU as reported in top. This is before opening a project, as well as with a project open. Games seem to run fine, its just an issue with the editor.

data.title: [Feature Request] QtCreator support on Windows (using VS2015 toolchain)
data.body:
When trying to build the engine and editor (using Qt 5.7, loading the CMakelists.txt as a project), I get the following error near the end of the process:

`NMAKE:-1: error: U1077: '"C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\8.1\bin\x64\mt.exe"' : return code '0x1f'`

Despite that, the executable builds. When trying to run it, however, it complains that libcef.dll is missing.
After manually copying the dll to the folder and starting, the application starts, but crashes almost immediatly with this error:

``` ---------------------------
Microsoft Visual C++ Runtime Library
---------------------------
Debug Error!

Program: ..._MSVC2013_64bit2-Default\Source\AtomicEditor\AtomicEditor.exe

R6010

- abort() has been called
```

This is shown in the console before the crash:

> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:45 2016] INFO: Opened log file C:/Users/Jan/AppData/Roaming/AtomicEditor/Logs/AtomicEditor.log
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:45 2016] INFO: Created 1 worker thread
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:45 2016] INFO: Added resource path C:/Coding/Github/AtomicGameEngine/Resources/CoreData/

> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:45 2016] DEBUG: Skipped autoload path 'Autoload' as it does not exist, check the documentation on how to set the 'resource prefix path'
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] INFO: Created Direct3D9 device
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] INFO: Set screen mode 1366x705 windowed resizable
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] INFO: Initialized input
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource Textures/Ramp.png
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] DEBUG: Loading temporary resource Textures/Ramp.xml
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource Textures/Spot.png
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] DEBUG: Loading temporary resource Textures/Spot.xml
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource Techniques/NoTexture.xml
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] DEBUG: Loading resource RenderPaths/Forward.xml
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] INFO: Initialized renderer
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] INFO: Set audio mode 44100 Hz stereo interpolated
> [Tue Aug 02 11:27:46 2016] INFO: Initialized engine

data.title: Fix for AtomicNETService path
Adding support for deploying managed applications
Standalone Atomic Editor can handle C# projects with VS2015 installed
NET Project Improvements (WIP)
data.body: This pull adds new project templates for pure C# applications, creates a default .user file for generated AtomicProject solution which allows immediately running project from VS, and some early NETProjectSystem hooks.  It also will open a C# file in project in VS if it is available on system
